pageTitle: Meadow Hills Golf Course in Aurora
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {5787=The 18-hole Meadow Hills Golf Course in Aurora, CO is a public golf course that opened in 1957. Designed by Henry Hughes, Meadow Hills Golf Course measures 6492 yards from the longest tees and has a slope rating of 125 and a 70.4 USGA rating. The course features 4 sets of tees for different skill levels. Greens and fairways are blue grass.}
textBeforeTable: Length, slope and rating for each tee Credit cards accepted: VISA, MasterCard, Discover Welcomed Dress code: Metal spikes allowed: No Course policies Weekends: $12 - $39 Week days: $12 - $33 Green fees price ranges Rental carts: Yes Rental clubs: Yes Driving range: Yes Pro in house: Yes Facilities Greens: Blue Grass Fairways: Blue Grass Tee times welcomed: Yes Guest Policy: Open Golf Season: Year round Year opened: 1957 Public/Private: Public Designed by: Henry Hughes Holes: 18 Golf course details Aurora, CO golf courses Colorado golf courses See also }); }); size:4 $("div.scrollable").scrollable({ jQuery(document).ready(function($) { jQuery.noConflict();
textAfterTable: Reader Ratings / Reviews Meadow Hills Golf Course by Johnny Golfer on July 13th, 2012 17:04 Very good course with a distinctly Midwestern feel - open fairways and large trees. The course is well maintained, perfectly groomed and fun. While not overly challenging, this is still a great place to play for the avid golfer. Expect municipal course players (people in t-shirts and jeans), but if you can look past the clientel, you'll have a great round. Meadow Hills Golf Course by Jason on June 17th, 2012 15:28 The greens were as true and fast as I have ever played. The trees are punishing, so it is best to punch out and minimize the damage. The apartments surrounding the 18th green remind me of PGA grandstands. I like this course. Meadow Hills Golf Course
